sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: On systems with a debugger, the environment "pauses" when execution reaches the break statement. While "pausing" is environment specific, in general, the program stops execution until the user presses the "Resume" or "Continue" button. While paused, the program variables can be inspected, stack traces done, etc.
sections.text_content: On systems with a debugger, the environment "pauses" when execution reaches the break statement. While "pausing" is environment specific, in general, the program stops execution until the user presses the "Resume" or "Continue" button. While paused, the program variables can be inspected, stack traces done, etc.
sections.mdown_content: On systems with a debugger, the environment "pauses" when execution reaches the **break** statement. While "pausing" is environment specific, in general, the program stops execution until the user presses the "Resume" or "Continue" button. While paused, the program variables can be inspected, stack traces done, etc.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 100
            put i
            break
        end for
